intro: Christisonia keralensis, commonly known as the Kerala Christisonia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in a compact inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories and is adapted to the humid tropical climate of its habitat. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
